results.title: Rocky horror and disco
results.brief_description: Choose from 20 songs selected from “The Rocky horror picture show” as well as disco hits set to an incongruous nature background. All lyrics appear on screen and the soundtrack is instrumental only. Please note: The disc plays PAL one side, NTSC the other.

results.title: Rocky
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen, Robert Chartoff, Irwin Winkler and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone), otherwise known as the “Italian Stallion” is an underdog challenged to fight the reigning heavyweight champion, Apollo Creed (Carl Weathers). Unperturbed and inspired by his dedicated manger Mickey (Burgess Meredith) and girlfriend Adrian (Talia Shire), Rocky has his eyes on the prize and a motivation to win. It is his one chance at fortune, self-respect, love and the world heavyweight crown. Filmed in only twenty eight days and with a screenplay written by Sylvester Stallone, “Rocky” won three Academy Awards including Best Picture.

results.title: Rocks and minerals: how do we identify them?
results.creator_credit: Tom Ascher and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Noticing the pattern, composition and texture of rocks we find that we can identify them, and gain clues how they are formed. Minerals are identified by tests which can lead to an understanding of processes occurring within the earth.

results.creator_credit: John Lord and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Topics covered include rocks as mixtures of crystalline minerals; the formation of igneous, sedimentary and metamorphic rocks; and the value of knowing about rocks.

results.title: Rocks and minerals
results.brief_description: Describes the three classes of rocks - igneous, sedimentary and metamorphic - and relates them to the natural conditions that produced them. Explains the varied uses of rocks and minerals in their natural state, including basalt, pumice, granite, limestone, sandstone, marble and others.

results.title: Rocking the foundations
results.creator_credit: Pat Fiske, Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch and Bower Bird Films
results.brief_description: A film that goes behind the headlines to look at the extraordinary chain of events that has made the New South Wales Builders’ Labourers’ Federation the controversial part of Australian history that it is today. It is a story about workers who began to act for themselves and make decisions about issues that affected ordinary people. Also looks at the new policies that saw women introduced into the building industry, limited tenure of office and the use of union power to assist resident action and environmental groups. Narrated by Pat Fiske. (NOTE: 16mm print is black and white.)

results.title: Rockets: how they work
results.brief_description: Uses animated drawings and models to show how rockets achieve motion, and compares rocket power with other types of motive power. Scenes at a rocket launching site show the count-down procedure and the take-off of a giant multistage rocket. Demonstrates the functioning of a rocket guidance system.

results.title: Rocket range Australia
results.creator_credit: W. H. Shepherd, Shan Benson, Dept of the Interior and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The Weapons Research Establishment at Salisbury and Woomera, South Australia. Shows the Salisbury Headquarters with its workshops, scientific testing of equipment, and wind tunnel. Also life in Woomera township and weapons research on the rocket range, including the engagement of a Jindivick pilotless aircraft by a Fireflash air-to-air missile and the launching of a skylark ground-to-air rocket.

results.title: Rocket man = Rocketman
results.creator_credit: Stuart Gillard, Roger Birnbaum, Caravan Pictures and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Light-weight comedy about the first manned mission to Mars. Chaos rules when Fred Z. Randall (Harland Williams) is called in as a last minute replacement to join the team of specialists, including the efficient Julie Ford (Jessica Lundy) and the trained chimp Ulysses. The vague and geeky Randall blunders from one disaster to the next as the mission rockets its way to Mars but he wins out in the end when his navigational skills save the day. Filmed on location at Houston and the Johnson Space Center. Cast also includes William Sadler, Jeffrey DeMunn, Beau Bridges.
